I think folks misunderstand me when I say: "pick your market first."

‚ùå "Market" = "A group I'd like to sell to." ‚úÖ "Market" = "A category where people are currently spending $."

Example: "The global diamond market is currently $82 billion USD."

A really useful responsive font-size calc() formula if you‚Äôre interested. I forget where I found it (probably @smashingmag) but used it for a long time:

minFS + (maxFS - minFS) * (100vw - minWidth)/(maxWidth - minWidth)

Ex. use: 18px + (24 - 18) * (100vw - 320px)/(960 - 320)

I learned about Fitts Law in grad school. In a desktop interface the easiest spots to hit are the corners and edges. Not so on a mobile device because no boundaries stop the movement of your finger  https://twitter.com/shoobe01/status/1017424444791377926 ‚Ä¶

Mobile is not desktop. Stop trying to squeeze 1990s Web 1.0 PC paradigms into your mobile app and websites.
